name: Helen Keller International
mission: Guided by our founder’s remarkable legacy, Helen Keller Intl works to improve the lives of people around the world by protecting vision, enhancing nutri...
theoryOfChange: Helen Keller International utilizes the 'Essential Nutrition Actions (ENA) framework' as an organizing framework for its strategy to improve maternal, infant, and young child nutrition. This framework provides an operational approach for advocacy, planning, training, and delivery of an integrated package of interventions designed to achieve public health impact. Additionally, their broader organizational strategy, 'Leading Locally, Fortifying Futures,' outlines their approach to sustaining core program areas of nutrition, vision, and health, and driving transformation in high-impact areas. The organization also emphasizes 'Rigor' as a core value, combining research, evidence, and on-the-ground experience to achieve large-scale and long-term impact.

zakatClaimEvidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly) (Source: https://helenkellerintl.org/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 37/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.
components.name: Financial Health

judge_issues.message: Expenses ($103,633,379) exceed revenue ($75,653,633) by 37% - may be drawing down reserves
BBB name 'Helen Keller Intl' may not match 'Helen Keller International' (similarity: 67%)

score_details.score_summary: Helen Keller International shows strong alignment and good impact.

zakat.claim_evidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly) (Source: https://helenkellerintl.org/)

all_citations.claim: The charity holds a 99.5/100 score and maintains a 82.8% program expense ratio.
Total revenue for the period was $145,494,796.
The organization manages significant in-kind medicine distributions as part of its systemic health impact.
Financial statements confirm the scale of donated medicines and global health programming.
The organization offers various donation options for its mission to save sight and improve nutrition.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial transparency and alignment with global health priorities, though its systemic change model results in a moderate impact score per beneficiary.
areas_for_improvement: High cost per beneficiary for specific systemic change interventions
Opportunity to further diversify program reach beyond core vision and nutrition sectors

dimension_explanations.alignment: Helen Keller International shows high alignment with donor interests in global health and has a long-standing track record of accountability [1][8]. As a Sadaqah-eligible organization, it provides a reliable pathway for general charitable giving toward urgent causes like blindness prevention and malnutrition [8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a commitment to systemic change in global health, managing a total revenue of $145,494,796 to fund its large-scale operations [2][7]. While it maintains a strong program expense ratio of 82.8%, the complex nature of its interventions results in a moderate impact score reflecting the high costs associated with long-term health infrastructure and medicine distribution [1][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: Helen Keller International transforms lives by preventing blindness and reducing malnutrition through evidence-based global health interventions.
strengths: Exceptional financial health with a Charity Navigator score of 99.5/100
Highly efficient fundraising operations costing only $0.03 per $1 raised
Robust liquidity with 18.6 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: Guided by the legacy of its founder, Helen Keller International works across the globe to protect vision and enhance nutrition for vulnerable populations [1][8]. The organization operates major initiatives including the US Vision Program and various international health care programs focused on saving sight [1][2].

all_citations.claim: overall score of 99.99.5/100 from Charity Navigator

all_citations.quote: This charity meets all 20 Standards for Charity Accountability

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial transparency and alignment with global health priorities, though its systemic change model results in a moderate impact score per beneficiary.

areas_for_improvement.detail: Certain systemic change interventions result in an average <cite id="18">cost of $2,063.76 per beneficiary</cite>, which is higher than direct-service peers.
With <cite id="10">18.6 months of working capital</cite>, the charity could improve transparency by publishing specific triggers for planned deployment of these high reserves.

bbb_assessment.summary: Meets all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards for Charity Accountability

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization focuses on long-term health system strengthening which has a higher upfront cost but more sustainable outcomes.
risk_factors: <cite id="18">Average cost of $2,063.76 per beneficiary</cite> due to systemic change focus
case_against.summary: The primary consideration for donors is the organization's <cite id="18">higher cost per beneficiary</cite> compared to charities focused solely on low-cost commodity distribution.

confidence.notes: Extremely high data availability and third-party verification.

alignment.improvement: Alignment could be strengthened by <cite id="21">expanding services to underserved geographies</cite> with even more limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can place high trust in this institution due to its <cite id="13">100% independent board</cite>, <cite id="11">Platinum Candid status</cite>, and <cite id="12">20/20 BBB standards compliance</cite>.

impact.explanation: The charity is highly efficient, with an <cite id="5">82.8% program expense ratio</cite> and <cite id="19">9 outcome metrics tracked</cite> via Candid.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement could be enhanced by documenting specific deployment plans for <cite id="10">excess working capital</cite> to further accelerate program reach.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Strong outcome tracking and theory of change

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Funds research and local health implementation partners

rich_narrative.headline: Helen Keller International transforms lives by preventing blindness and reducing malnutrition through evidence-based global health interventions.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value long-term health system strengthening and want to support a century-old institution with elite financial transparency.
donor_motivations: Want to support evidence-based blindness prevention
Prefer supporting established institutions with global reach
giving_considerations: Donations support systemic changes rather than just one-off aid
High liquidity means the charity is financially very stable
Focus is on global health rather than religious infrastructure
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill Zakat obligations or those looking for the lowest possible cost-per-meal metrics.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade B reflects <cite id="19">9 tracked outcome metrics</cite> and a <cite id="23">strong, documented theory of change</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The charity utilizes a systemic change model to integrate vision and nutrition services into existing government health structures.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that large-scale health interventions actually reduce the prevalence of preventable blindness.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While revenue is growing at <cite id="7">27.7% annually</cite>, the high reserve levels suggest some immediate capacity.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Maintains a <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 82.8%</cite>, which exceeds the <cite id="22">peer median of 87.6%</cite>.

strengths.detail: The charity demonstrates elite fiscal management with <cite id="9">fundraising efficiency of $0.03 per $1 raised</cite> and a high program ratio.
The organization maintains <cite id="10">18.6 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant buffer for long-term project stability.
Helen Keller International holds the <cite id="11">Candid Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> and meets all <cite id="12">20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Helen Keller International's financial health is among the strongest in the international development sector. Their <cite id="1">99.99.5/100 from Charity Navigator rating</cite> is supported by a <cite id="13">100% independent board</cite> and rigorous <cite id="14">audited financial statements</cite>. This fiscal discipline allows them to manage <cite id="15">$25,088,380 in total grants</cite>, including significant <cite id="16">foreign grants totaling $23,400,456</cite> across 301 recipients. Their ability to scale is evidenced by the <cite id="17">$120,173,218 value of in-kind medicine distribution</cite> reported in recent cycles, leveraging corporate partnerships to maximize impact.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 1915, Helen Keller International is a premier global health organization dedicated to <cite id="1">preventing blindness and reducing malnutrition</cite> for vulnerable populations worldwide. The organization maintains an <cite id="2">overall score of 99.99.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting its status as a highly accountable and transparent institution. With a <cite id="3">total revenue of $145,494,796</cite> in 2023, the charity operates at a significant scale, reaching communities across <cite id="4">Africa and Asia</cite> to combat diseases of poverty. Their work is characterized by a <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 82.8%</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of donor contributions directly support field operations. Beyond international work, they manage the <cite id="6">US Vision Program</cite>, providing screenings and eyeglasses to students in underserved American communities. The organization's financial sustainability is underscored by a <cite id="7">3-year revenue CAGR of 27.7%</cite>, demonstrating robust growth and increasing capacity to address global health crises. By focusing on high-impact interventions like <cite id="8">Vitamin A supplementation</cite> and the elimination of neglected tropical diseases, Helen Keller International transforms the lives of millions who would otherwise lack access to essential care.
